questions.question_text:
You are responsible for deploying an application on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). The application is memory intensive and performs poorly if enough memory is not available. You have created an instance pool of Linux compute instances in OCI to host the application and defined Autoscaling Configuration for the instance pool.
What should you do to ensure that the instance pool autoscales to prevent poor application performance?

discussion.content: D is correct. the question is about an application which is memory intensive. Auto scaling use CPU/Memory as performance metrics

choices.D: Configure the autoscaling policy to monitor memory usage and scale up the number of instances when it meets the threshold.
choices.B: Configure the autoscaling policy to monitor CPU usage and scale up the number of instances when it meets the threshold.
choices.A: Install OCI SDK on all compute instances and create a script that triggers the autoscaling event if there is high memory usage.
choices.C: Install the monitoring agent on all compute instances, which triggers the autoscaling group.

questions.question_text:
You have a high-demand web application running on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). Your tenancy administrator has set up a schedule-based autoscaling policy on instance pool with an initial size of 5 instances for the application.
Policy 1:

Target pool size: 10 instances -
Execution time: 8:30 a.m. on every Monday through Friday, in every month, in every year
Cron expression: 0 30 8 ? * MON-FRI *
Which statement accurately explains the goal of this policy?

choices.D: Goal: A recurring monthly schedule. On all days of the month, set the initial pool size to 5 instances. At 8.30 a.m., on every day of the month, scale out to 10 instances.
choices.A: Goal: A recurring weekly schedule. On all days of the week at 8.30 a.m., scale out the pool to 10 instances from the initial size of 5.
choices.B: Goal: A one-time schedule with only one scaling out event. At 8:30 a.m., on December 31, 2021, scale the instance pool to 10 instances from 5.
choices.C: Goal: A recurring daily schedule. On weekdays (Monday through Friday) at 8.30 a.m., scale out to 10 instances.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This is a recurring daily schedule. Not Weekly, monthly or one time.

questions.question_text:
You just got a last minute request to create a set of instances in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). The configuration and installed software are identical for every instance, and you already have a running instance in your OCI tenancy.
Which image option allows you to achieve this task with the least amount of effort?

choices.D: Use Oracle-provided images and customize the installation using a third-party tool.
choices.B: Select an image from the OCI Marketplace.
choices.A: Bring your own image and use it as a template for the new instances.
choices.C: Create a custom image and use it as a template for the new instances.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
It says there is already an instance running, so you can create a custom image from that. You can create a custom image of an instance's boot disk and use it to launch other instances. Instances you launch from your image include the customizations, configuration, and software installed when you created the image. Custom images do not include the data from any attached block volumes.
C. Create a custom image and use it as a template for the new instances.

questions.question_text:
You are backing up your on-premises data to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Object Storage Service.
Your requirements are:
1. Backups need to be retained for at least full 31 days.
2. Data should be accessible immediately if and when needed after the backup.
Which OCI Object Storage tier is suitable for storing the backup to minimize cost?

discussion.content:
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Object/Tasks/usingmultipartuploads.htm

* While a multipart upload is still active, you can keep adding parts as long as the total number is less than 10,000.
* With multipart upload, you split the object you want to upload into individual parts. Individual parts can be as large as 50 GiB

choices.C: While a multipart upload is still active, you can keep adding parts as long as the total number is less than 10,000.
choices.B: You do not need to split the object into parts. Object Storage splits the object into parts and uploads all of the parts automatically.
choices.D: When you split the object into individual parts, each part can be as large as 50 GiB.
choices.A: You do not have to commit the upload after you have uploaded all the object parts.
